DataElement.preferredName: First Recurrent Disease Chemotherapy Therapy Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the name of the action or administration of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process of the initial return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to action or administration of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process of the initial return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Property.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
